intro: Weinmannia rollottii var. subvelutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf weinmannia, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The leaves are typically elliptical, with a soft, fuzzy texture and a pale green color. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
